data.title: Color exploit.
data.body:
#8380 works pretty good in the bleed. But it doesnt fix the spectator exploit.

You can pick colors that aren't supposed to be allowed (Like the color I always roll with). To choose these colors you can edit the config file and then jump in a game. All you got to do is switch slots and you get your color. Not sure if there is a fix for this but you can watch all of my games and see how I have been doing.

data.title: Add IRC library to the install rules.
reset RallyPoint Location after building was captured. resolves #9163.
data.body: resolves #9163.

data.title: Implement the TS EMPulse SW.
data.body:
I'm not certain how viable is this though, because Armament requires AttackBase but this doesn't use that.

Also it needs an estimation of the projectile reaching target for camera/beacon purposes, see comment on diff.

data.title: Per-mod AUTHORS file
data.body:
```
[20:39:38]  <Phroh|work> pchote: Would you be against moving (or allowing a new) mod authors out to their own file? mods/ra2/AUTHORS
[20:39:55]  <pchote> not at all
[20:40:18]  <pchote> if we want to do "everything is a tab" now, we could have tabs in the credits page
[20:40:24]  <Phroh|work> Okay, cool. I'll open a ticket.
[20:40:27]  <pchote> one for openra, and one for the mod if it includes the right file 
```

data.title: Add infantry stealth detection to D2k
data.body:
So they can detect fremen, saboteurs and stealth raiders.

Note:
- the radius needs to be a bit larger than 1 cell to make sure the subcell doesn't matter that much

data.title: Fix TS sensor array DetectCloaked range
Increase the speed of HIJACKER
data.body: Adds the speed buff missed in #9668.

data.title: Stealth Detection is broken/not functional
data.body:
DetectCloaked seems not to be working at all.

It also looks like RenderDetectionCircle doesn't work too.

data.title: Now that RA2 is free, should we put Volkov back in?
data.body: I only recall him being removed due to using RA2 assets?

data.title: Fix singleplayer game latency.
data.body: Fixes #9817.

data.title: Restore OrderDelay = 1 for missions/skirmish
data.body:
Before the refactorings related to gamespeed, singleplayer games were always set to an order delay of 1. This is no longer the case, and particularly on 'fastest', the delay is very noticable when navigating the UI.

It would be nice if we could restore the old "force order delay to 1 when it's a singleplayer game, regardless of game speed" behavior.

data.title: DllNotFoundException libgdiplus.dylib when installing with Homebrew
data.body:
Hi all

Firstly, massive thanks for this project, I was very excited when I found it.

I installed OpenRA using the git instructions on the AppStore (http://macappstore.org/openra/), there were no errors during the installation process.

Sadly, when I attempt to launch it, I get the following fatal error:

Fatal Error

OpenRA has encountered a fatal error and must close.
Please refer to the crash logs and FAQ for more information.

The only non-empty log from ~/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/Logs was exception.log (attached).
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13199829/10863004/e6353e2c-7fc7-11e5-95b6-353b0c321f73.png)

I am running a mac with OS 10.6.8.
Any ideas why I am getting this error or how I can fix it?

Thanks
Dan
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27852874-dllnotfoundexception-libgdiplus-dylib-when-installing-with-homebrew?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Attacking an invulnerable unit should display an animation/play a sound
data.body: In RA2, attacking an iron curtained unit displays an animation/plays a sound to indicate that it is invulnerable.

data.title: Allied War Factory is drawn above some units in front of it
data.body: Build an allied WF and place a unit along the long side of it (the side facing the user). The unit is drawn under, not on top of, the building.

data.title: RallyPoint palette tracks owner
data.body: Fixes #9154.

data.title: Fix missing production bar on captured factories
data.body: Fixes #9811.

data.title: Captured production building does not show production progress bar
data.body:
Noticed during a multiplayer game, could easily reproduce in a test game with AI. Release 20150919 

![Image](http://i.imgur.com/9HlaztI.png)

Top war factory one was build by myself
Bottom war factory was captured with engineer

Captured barracks showed the same behaviour.

data.title: Replace MiniYaml Ticks with Delay/Duration
Fix Giant Ants and Zombies not being able to attack diagonally
data.body: As described in #9331, melee ants and zombies couldn't attack diagonal directions. This was fixed by setting their attack range to 1 cell and a half.

data.title: Several fixes for cloak behavior
data.body:
- Reworked the cloak class
  - Removed code duplication when granting upgrades
  - Use explicit interface implementations where possible
  - Added optional `UncloakOnDamage` which uncloaks actors when at least one tick damage taken
  - Play sound when being cloaked by an upgrade
  - Don't play sounds when cloaked by another cloaking trait
  - Uncloak actors when `UncloakOnAttack==true` and they are charging
  - Refactored all loose `UncloakOn*` booleans and merged them into one enum
- Extended/Reworked TS cloaking behavior
  - Cloak Aircraft via cloaking generator
  - Uncloak actors and buildings on damage taken
  - Added Sounds for cloaking

data.title: RA2: Cloning Vats allow production of some units
data.body: A Cloning Vats alone is capable of producing attack dogs and engineers. It also shows Tesla Troopers on the build menu, but grayed out because there are no barracks.

data.title: Dustbowl map has derrick half cut off
data.body: The southmost oil derrick in the Dustbowl map is too far south and is half cut off by the boundary shroud. Alternatively, the boundary is too far north.

data.title: RA2: Dustbowl map has no starting ore
data.body: It only has starting ore augurs (screws? what are they called?)

data.title: RA2: Kirovs crash
data.body:
Was playing a game where I got the following crash:

```
Red Alert 2 Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map 8854f37b07d825819ac91b5fca488d4ca16764de (dustbowl by Westwood Studios).
Operating System: Linux (Unix 4.2.0.1)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-10) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Actor type 'zep' does not define a quantized body orientation.
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.BodyOrientation+<BodyOrientation>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Lazy`1[System.Int32].InitValue () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

This appears to happen whenever a Kirov tries to deploy.

data.title: RA2: Unit prereq descriptions are inconsistent about refineries
data.body: The hover-description of some buildings is inconsistent about what a refinery is called. Some (Soviet Radar) say "Ore Refinery", some (War Factory) say "Refinery".

data.title: Fix MoveWithinRange not moving far enough for min range checks
data.body:
MoveWithinRange was only moving the unit far enough away so the center of the target was above the minimum distance. However, the min range checks in the attack code require all positions on the target to be above the minimum distance. For large targets (e.g. buildings) this means some of the target was still too close, and the unit would get stuck in a loop.

Now MoveWithinRange uses the same range checks in order to ensure units are moved the correct distances.

Fixes #9789.

data.title: Display team colors on radar.
data.body:
Adds an option to display actors on radar in colors denoting their diplomatic stance toward the player.
![team-radar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10833737/1e8e19ca-7e8c-11e5-92b9-b60cef6d0a86.png)

This means players who use colors similar to the terrain are on equal terms with players who opt for bright contrasting colours.

Currently hotkey is 'm'.
